text:
I have three separate WSUS parent servers. If I look up an old (superseded) KB
on the parent server for example KB4486726 (32 or 64 bit version) all 3 parent
servers show nothing superseding this update, as well as this update not
superseding any other update. If I look on a child server, I see this update is
superseded by KB5002121 (as verified on the web page for that KB) as well as
superseding KB4484435, KB4484356 and KB4011104. 
On my parent server I routinely decline all superseded updates, but these never
get declined because the parent servers show no supersedence. If I look at a
child server, I see a whole bunch of superseded updates (that should have been
declined but were not because of the faulty info on the parent). 
I don't think this is just as issue with a corrupted WSUS database on the parent
as the third WSUS server I tried on was a fresh test install I recently made on
a spare server. 
Tom 
--
%2BQCegQ-CYdYeTSM1xXKEDV_-1XF8c6KCjEu-pL6bg%40mail.gmail.com

metadata.email_text_original:
WSUS supersedence info is broken 
You don't often get email from tom.alverson@gmail.com. Learn why this is
important [https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
I have three separate WSUS parent servers.  If I look up an old (superseded) KB
on the parent server for example KB4486726 (32 or 64 bit version) all 3 parent
servers show nothing superseding this update, as well as this update not
superseding any other update.  If I look on a child server, I see this update is
superseded by KB5002121 (as verified on the web page for that KB) as well as
superseding KB4484435, KB4484356  and KB4011104. 
On my parent server I routinely decline all superseded updates, but these never
get declined because the parent servers show no supersedence.  If I look at a
child server, I see a whole bunch of superseded updates (that should have been
declined but were not because of the faulty info on the parent). 
I don't think this is just as issue with a corrupted WSUS database on the parent
as the third WSUS server I tried on was a fresh test install I recently made on
a spare server. 
Tom 
--
Link: https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/patchmanagement/CALbuhAv_x%2BQCegQ-CYdYeTSM1xXKEDV_-1XF8c6KCjEu-pL6bg%40mail.gmail.com
